answers.answer: Hi, proteinuria is quite suggestive of renal compromise which could be related with glomerulonephritis, nephrotic syndrome, chronic kidney disease etc. Main defect lies in filtration process of kidneys. Do you have history of diabetes or hypertension? Please do consult nephrologist and get yourself investigated.Salt restriction, Diuretics, ACE inhibitors are usually given for the treatment. For more information visit http://www.emedicine.com/ped/topic3048.htm

question: i have had a uti since june of this year that with treatment will not go away. and now im having problems with my arms, hands, legs, feet, and face swelling. i have a high trace of protein in my urine. the amount of protein is 300. i am also having problems with my legs a hands going to sleep. what do you think is wrong with me?
title: high trace of proein in urine
